str2: Cornelius, a centurion of the Roman army, stationed at Caesarea. Of Latin origin; Cornelius, a Roman.
A centurion of the Roman army. Or hekatontarchos hek-at-on'-tar-khos; from hekaton and archo; the captain of one hundred men.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From chrema; to utter an oracle, i.e. Divinely intimate; by implication, to constitute a firm for business, i.e. bear as a title.
To send for, summon. From meta and pempo; to send from elsewhere, i.e. to summon or invite.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
And, even, also, namely.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
